medical_history.chief_complaint: Asymmetric sensory loss and paresthesias in both arms and legs as well as impaired dexterity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 5 months ago, starting with hands and feet feeling wrapped tightly, most prominent in the right hand and arm and left foot and leg. Approximately 2.5 months prior to evaluation, difficulty with fine motor control and recognizing objects by feel developed in both hands. Symptoms worsened, with numbness and tingling in both arms and hands, intermittent shooting pain, and increased difficulty keeping balance, especially while dressing. The patient lost about 17 kg due to decreased appetite and difficulty feeding herself.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Three years prior, evaluated for episodes of numbness and tingling over the shoulders extending to the neck, resolved without treatment. History of mild Raynaudâ€™s phenomenon.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of diabetes and breast cancer; father died from cardiac disease; siblings have ulcerative colitis and myasthenia gravis.
medical_history.social_history: Married, lived with husband, office worker, 25-pack-year smoking history (quit 1 year ago), moderate alcohol use, no illicit drug use or exposure to metals, toxins, or high vitamin doses.
